title: arlene foster martin mcguinness was behind a number of ira atrocities right into the s
story: Jim Allister: DUP has shown weakness to Dublin, London and Brussels by operating the North-South bodies   Orange Order not surprised by huge interest in Northern Ireland Centenary parade date announcementNewsLatestTraffic and TravelCrimeWeatherPoliticsBusinessEducationHealthOpinionPeopleRead ThisSportFootballMotorcyclingRugby UnionOther SportOpinionWhats OnThings To DoArts and EntertainmentNightleRetroLestyleEating OutCarsHomes and GardensHomes and GardensCoronaviruse-PaperFarmingRecommendedEntertainmentTechnologyLestyleHome and GardenFashion and BeautyDealsPuzzlesPublic NoticesFree Happy AdsNewsPoliticsArlene Foster: Martin McGuinness was behind a number of IRA atrocities right into the sArlene Foster has said that her previous partner in government Martin McGuinness was responsible for “a number of atrocities” right up into the s.By Adam KulaFriday, th November , : amUpdated Friday, th November , : am  "       "  The ex-DUP leader made the comments in a piece she has written as part of a project for Belfast’s Linenhall Library.She does not specy which atrocities she believes he was responsible for.McGuinness himself claimed to have quit the IRA in , though this is widely disbelieved.   " fill"#ea"   to our daily newsletterThe i newsletter cut through the noiseThanks for signing up!Sorry, there seem to be some issues. Please try again later.Submitting...Arlene Foster’s first TV appearance, at age , after the IRA bombed her school busMrs Foster also voiced pessimism about the Province’s political prospects, suggesting Sinn Fein does not “want Northern Ireland to work”.Mrs Foster’s comments came as part of an exhibition called ExtraORDINARY Women, comprised of stories and opinions from a raft of Northern Irish women in dferent fields.The main thrust of her piece is the isive nature of politics in Northern Ireland, and she laments that anybody who even exchanges a pleasant word with a political opponent risks marking themselves out as “weak” and “weird”.Mrs Foster – now aged  – first came to public attention when she gave an interview to national television at age , after the IRA detonated a bomb on her school bus.A solicitor by trade, she was elected as an MLA in , for her home constituency of Fermanagh and South Tyrone.She then ditched the UUP in  and joined the DUP.Down the years she has been Northern Ireland’s minister for enterprise, the environment, and finance, as well as being First Minister from May , , to June , , when she was ousted in a coup that brought Edwin Poots to power – before his leadership crumbled too mere weeks later.Her contribution piece for the museum is titled ‘A Little Less Twitter, A Lot More Thought and Direct Conversation’, and begins: “When you leave elected office in the fashion I have, the obvious question is: ‘What are you going to do next ’“The honest answer is I’m not really sure! There are plenty of things I’d like to do, but what one is capable of doing is an altogether dferent kettle of fish!”It continues as follows: “For so long now I have been steeped in NI and its dficult politics.“Yes, all politics is challenging – it’s part of the reason why we do it, but being the leader of the largest Unionist party whilst a privilege of course brings its own downsides. “Due to the nature of politics here the isiveness is stark – you are seen as somewhat strangeyou have friends in other political parties. “It reminds me of the Labour member who claimed proudly that she had never, nor would she ever, snog a Tory. “Well in NI,you are in the pleasant-exchange-territory then you are seen as somewhat of a weakling, never mind the latter!“Looking in at the Palace of Westminster I had always thought politics to be mostly civil. “Of course that is a generalisation, and I found that out when I attended a Policy Exchange event to launch the ‘The age of Incivility: Understanding the new politics’ back in . “The subsequent call for evidence was important because it is right that we understand the issue from a data point of view, rather than anecdotal stories – of which some of us have many! “The launch was chaired by Trevor Phillips former Equality and Human Rights Commission Chair and was attended by members from across the political spectrum – and that’s the important point: people from dferent perspectives discussing issues in a civilised fashion. “Unfortunately, the language in Westminster politics is not improving because, as I write this blog, the deputy leader of the Labour Part, Angela Rayner has just called the Tories ‘scum’. Not much progress there. “When I was First Minister of Northern Ireland I shared an office with the deputy First Minister, firstly Martin McGuiness and then Michelle O’Neill. “Both were steeped in Irish republicanism.“In McGuinness’ case he was a self-confessed member of the IRA and responsible for a number of atrocities in the s and s. “For many in NI they could not understand how I could even bear to be in the same room never mind share an office. “For me it was about trying to secure a better Northern Ireland for the future and that meant not ignoring their beliefs or history, far from it, but trying to disagree well. “In other words, recognising where there was common ground and building on that, and trying to deal with areas where we had fundamental dferences in a way that did not do damage to the system of government given to us by the Belfast Agreement. “In other words, I was trying to show that politics worked not the alternative which I had grown up with.“For NI politics to be successful however both sides have to want it to work and I’m not sure that’s the case in Northern Ireland with Sinn Fein pushing for constitutional change whatever the cost to our citizens. “In today’s social media world of politics not even subtle points are lost in translation. I really regret that. “Yes, your opponents are always going to spin your point of view to suit their agenda, but  characters is not enough space for a political argument to be put forward, never mind digested and contradicted. “The main stream broadcasters are becoming just as bad with their soundbite headlines.“Say something outrageous in Parliament and you will be on the  o’clock news. “Develop a political argument in a thoughtful way and try to persuade others of your point of view and it will not make the cut.“Is this the political discussion we want or need  “Of all places in the world Northern Ireland needs nuance and understanding in its politics and none of the social media s allow that to happen. “We need a little less Twitter and a lot more thought and direct conversation. There may then be a little less outrage – I can but hope. “So, in answer to the question: ‘What are you going to do next ’, the answer is partly at least to try and ensure there is a space for civil debate without the drama and sometimes the hatred which is all too often a mark of social media. “AF.”The ExtraORDINARY Women exhibition is open from Monday and runs until December .It is comprised of both online testimoniesand physical artefacts.The library will host an in-person and online celebration on Monday, November .To watch, go to this link: vimeo event For more, click here: ‘What school grades do I need to join PSNI – and how much will I earn ’Click here: Date is set for massive Orange centenary parade in Northern Ireland – akin to ’s vast Ulster Covenant march——— ———A message from the Editor:Thank you for reading this story on our website. title: major report suggests irish sea border boosts ni roi ties and severs gb ones
story: Woman dies following road collision in Co Antrim   Arlene Foster: Martin McGuinness was behind a number of IRA atrocities right into the sNewsLatestTraffic and TravelCrimeWeatherPoliticsBusinessEducationHealthOpinionPeopleRead ThisSportFootballMotorcyclingRugby UnionOther SportOpinionWhats OnThings To DoArts and EntertainmentNightleRetroLestyleEating OutCarsHomes and GardensHomes and GardensCoronaviruse-PaperFarmingRecommendedEntertainmentTechnologyLestyleHome and GardenFashion and BeautyDealsPuzzlesPublic NoticesFree Happy AdsNewsPoliticsMajor report suggests Irish Sea border boosts NI   ROI ties – and severs GB onesThere has been a gigantic upswell in trade between Northern Ireland and the Republic of Ireland since the Irish Sea border came into effect.By Adam KulaFriday, th November , : am  "       "  Larne Port NIThat is one of the key points contained in a report by the UK’s National Audit Office into post-Brexit arrangements, published this morning.To gauge the effect on trade of the Irish Sea border , the auditors looked at figures from the Republic of Ireland’s Central Statistics Office .These showed that exports from Ireland to Northern Ireland between January and August  “increased by % compared with the previous year”.   " fill"#ea"   to our daily newsletterThe i newsletter cut through the noiseThanks for signing up!Sorry, there seem to be some issues. Please try again later.Submitting...Meanwhile “goods imports from Northern Ireland to Ireland had also increased by % over the same period year-on-year”.Whilst the coronavirus pandemic will have skewed the figures, it adds that they “may also indicate that trade is erting from GB-NI trade routes to Ireland-NI trade routes”.On January , , the UK formally left the EU.A transition period was in place though, meaning very little changed.Then on December , , the transition period ended and the NI Protocol came into effect.Nevertheless, a number of grace periods are still in place, protecting certain sectors from the full brunt of the protocol.It is not clear when these will end.For example, the grace period for medicines coming from GB to NI is meant to expire on January , , but at the moment it looks like it is being kept going indefinitely.Elsewhere in the report, figures show that the amount of money going on building the bricks-and-mortar of the Irish Sea border is eclipsed by the amount the government is spending to help firms overcome that border.It says “the government’s current allocated funding for infrastructure required for checks at the border” stands at £m .Meanwhile, £m+ has been earmarked “to support businesses trading in Northern Ireland”.CLICK HEREgtgtgt ‘I mean, what ! Republicans must be laughing their heads off!’ – Reg Empey slams DUP over Protocol dealings CLICK HEREgtgtgt Sir Jeffrey Donaldson and Jim Allister in war of words over NI Protocol deadline____________________________________________________________A message from the Editor:Thank you for reading this story on our website. title: mike nesbitt joins calls for apology over mlas sectarian ruc comments
story: Prof Jon Tonge’s survey of all polls show only % support for a united Ireland and over % support for the Union   Arlene Foster: Martin McGuinness was behind a number of IRA atrocities right into the sNewsLatestTraffic and TravelCrimeWeatherPoliticsBusinessEducationHealthOpinionPeopleRead ThisSportFootballMotorcyclingRugby UnionOther SportOpinionWhats OnThings To DoArts and EntertainmentNightleRetroLestyleEating OutCarsHomes and GardensHomes and GardensCoronaviruse-PaperFarmingRecommendedEntertainmentTechnologyLestyleHome and GardenFashion and BeautyDealsPuzzlesPublic NoticesFree Happy AdsNewsPoliticsMike Nesbitt joins calls for apology over MLA’s ‘sectarian’ RUC commentsA row over an MLA’s claim the RUC represented “institutionalised sectarianism” has escalated with Mike Nesbitt joining calls for Dolores Kelly to apologise.By Mark RaineyFriday, th November , : pm  "       "  RUC officer at the scene of a terrorist atrocity in Belfast city centre in . Photo: PacemakerUpper Bann MLA Mrs Kelly was quoted in a newspaper article as saying this week’s PSNI th anniversary was the perfect opportunity to recommit to the principle of a shared police force. The SDLP policing board member also said the creation of the PSNI was a “signicant departure from the institutionalised sectarianism represented by the RUC”.Those comments led to the NI Retired Police Officers’ Association penning an open letter to Mrs Kelly, in which the NIRPOA chairman called on the MLA to withdraw her remarks, and to apologise for the “gross offence” caused.   " fill"#ea"   to our daily newsletterThe i newsletter cut through the noiseThanks for signing up!Sorry, there seem to be some issues. Please try again later.Submitting...The letter states: “I am writing to seek your immediate withdrawal of that remark, and an apology for the gross offence you have caused to the thousands of members of the Royal Ulster Constabulary GC who served this community in the most challenging of times.”Mrs Kelly responded, saying: “The SDLP has previously paid tribute to the sacrices made by many RUC officers and their families.“The fact remains that there were severe institutional problems within the RUC and this is a matter of public record. That many retired police officers continue to refuse to cooperate with legacy investigations to this day speaks for itself.”Mrs Kelly added: “The transformation of the RUC to the PSNI has been an outstanding success and whilst policing continues to be challenging I think the hard work and efforts of the those involved in implementing Patten’s recommendations deserve credit.”Ulster Unionist policing board member Mr Nesbitt said he believes his SDLP counterpart should “reflect on her comments and the hurt they have caused and apologise”.He said: “The RUC were the barrier between Northern Ireland and complete anarchy. They bravely held the line throughout the Troubles.“Dolores Kelly’s comments have caused great hurt to former officers, their families and friends. Police officers didn’t wake up hoping to hurt someone, but every terrorist did, and it was police officers who were targeted simply because they were trying to protect society and save lives”.Mr Nesbitt added: “Nobody disputes that the RUC could have done with more Catholic officers within its ranks.“I have no doubt that many more would have come forward had it not been for the fact that the IRA made a special effort to target those Catholics who did join the RUC”.Mike NesbittPSNI  "       "  Get the latest news on the CoronavirusWe have launched a daily public interest bulletin to title: ogmore by sea one uks best dog friendly beaches
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityThe region comes in at fth place with  beaches dogs are able to use  days a year. It comes in behind Pembrokeshire at first place with  beaches, Devon with , Cornwall with  and Anglesey with .The research comes as people are looking to continue to holiday at home as Wales and the UK begins to re-open and international travel is still looking unsure. It was carried out by Uswitch and can be viewed here: https:www.uswitch car-insurance guides uk-dog-friendly-beaches-mapped In their list of  beaches from across the UK, Ogmore Beach comes in third place behind Cayton Bay in North Yorkshire and Oxwich Beach near Swansea.MORE NEWS:Coronavirus: One in three adults in Wales now fully vaccinatedDream seaside home has seven bedrooms and an amazing al-fresco entertaining areaLaurence Llewellyn-Bowen joins campaign to transform oldest Vale homeThe Uswitch guide says that Ogmore Beach is best for fishing, walking and dog-friendly pubs and the car park costs pound a day, with dogs allowed on the beach all-year round and there are no restrictions. They say that the beach is a sand and shingle beach and has a reputation for being one of the cleanest in the region. There is a coastal walk, chance to go fishing, surfing and views of Tusker Rock.For those owners who may not yet have ventured to the beach with their pups or are concerned about behaviour while at the beach, Wood Greenrsquos dog behaviour and training specialist, Wendy Kruger, has provided some tips to prepare your dog for the beach.bull Ensure your dogrsquos microchip and collar tag details are up to date ndash just in case.bull Get used to checking ground surface temperatures before you take your dog out, as dry sand can be too hot for dogsrsquo paws on sunny days. To check the ground temperature, place the back of your hand on the ground. If its too hot to hold comfortably for five seconds, itrsquos too hot for dogsrsquo paws..removebull Practise basic, reward-based training when out and about to help your dog to maintain focus and engagement on walks.bull Recall is also an area that needs particular attention. Evenyour dog has a great recall at home, its not something that can be guaranteed in unfamiliar environments with exciting new distractions. Games with toys are a fantastic way to help your dog engage with you when there are other distractions around. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentComments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. title: vale author details history welsh pubs new book
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityGraham Loveluck-Edwards has announced the release of his new book Historic Pubs of Wales where he relishes in some of the more colourful myths, legends and stories from Wales ancient past and oldest pubs.Included in the book is The Captains We, in Sully,a house originally owned by a captain."I have always loved old pubs, and we are blessed to have so many belters here in Wales," added Mr Loveluck-Edwards.Graham Loveluck-Edwards out snapping some pubs for his book "For example, the pub which claims to have an elephant buried under its beer garden, or the pub where funeral parties take a short cut to the cemetery through the bar to keep an ancient right of access alive, or the pub that claims to have invented pancake day and so many more."In all, Ive compiled over  incredible stories based around  amazing old pubs - is there any truth to them "Some for sure, but this book captures them and puts them in the context of history so you can be the judge."MORE NEWS:The book also contains a travel guide so readers can go on a tour around Wales and visit all the pubs in the book.You can find out more at www.talesfromhistoricpubsofwales.The book is available to buy now "As you can imagine for such a book the research was relentless and thorough, and a lot of fun," he added."Pubs have had such a tough time in the last year with us going in and out of lockdowns and with the introduction of social distancing measures."Sixteenth centuryinns are usually a warren of tiny rooms so being two metres apart has made opening and trading near impossible for many."So, a book which celebrates all that is great about our old pubs, which tells people their history, where to find them and what to expect when you get there has been welcomed by all landlords." article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentComments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - title: family pay tribute barry journalist sharon harris
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communitySharon Harris was found dead in her home on Tuesday, October , aged of .She worked as a journalist in Barry for years, including a -year stint at the Barry and District News. Most recently she worked withthe newly-formedGlamorgan Star.Tributes flooded in as news of her death broke, as she was a journalist that dedicated her le to putting the community of Barry first.Her family said in a statement: "It is so dficult to find the words to sum up my beautul sister and beloved daughter."She was simply our everything and a can-do girl."She overcame so much adversity with her health, but without complaining just got on with living le to the fullest - travelling, volunteering, fundraising and making memories."She was dedicated to being a voice for the Barry community that she loved so much and it was more than a job."Like us, were sure the town will mourn the loss of the kindest, most inspirational woman you could ever wish to meet."We, her family, are devastated."Echoing these words, local politicians who saw Sharon frequently have expressed their condolences.Jane Hutt, MS for the Vale of Glamorgan and minister for social justice said: "Sharon Harris was a champion for the communities she served as local newspaper journalist."She was utterly committed to her job and always seeking the stories which would shine a light on political and public affairs."I admired her tenacity and hard work and was thrilled she was back in force as a leading member of the Glamorgan Star team after  years at Barry and District News."I will always remember taking photos and getting copy at events and requesting lsquoa commentrsquo with deadlines on many dficult but important issues..remove"Dear Sharon you will be greatly missed in the Vale of Glamorgan. RIP.":Cllr Lis Burnett, deputy leader of the Vale of Glamorgan Council, said: ldquoSharon served the Vale of Glamorgan and Barry in particular as a tenacious local reporter for many years."At the Barry and District News and the Glamorgan Star her journalism told the stories of the people that make up our communities."If someone had a story to tell then Sharon gave them a voice."Her death has shocked us all and she will be greatly missed." article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentComments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. - everything you need to knowHeadliner Stuart Goldsmith " Popular comedy night s with new venue - everything you need to knowLorna Prichard" Popular comedy night s with new venue - everything you need to knowSarah Bridgeman" Popular comedy night s with new venue - everything you need to knowDon Biswas" Skip to next photo Show caption  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl" href" my account emailthispage " s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentA SELL-OUT comedy show, which will have you howling with laughter, is relaunching bigger and better than before.Howl comedy nights were founded by Lorna Prichard, starting at Cardfs Tramshed in .In  she left her job reporting for ITV Wales and ldquoswapped headlines for punchlines going into stand-up comedy Howlbecame a monthly event in Penarthrsquos Pier Pavilion in March .ldquoIt was very successful at Pier Pavilion, selling out to  maximum capacity most months, said Ms Prichard.ldquoI always try to curate a really ied, interesting line up of comedians, and my style of MCing is warm, energetic and a little bit chaotic, which seems to go down well."She planned to move the event to a bigger venue, with Penarth Town Council supporting the venture, then the Covid pandemic hit.Although live events were on hold, Ms Prichard kept busy shegot caught up in a whirlwind romance with a Brazilian called Leo ndash they dated long distance before meeting and getting engaged within  hours.ldquoThat descended into typical chaos, laughed Ms Prichard.ldquoI canrsquot wait to share my lockdown experiences with the audience.And share she will ndash with Howl ing for a monthly Saturday night show, with Glee Club level comedians, at Paget Rooms.ldquoIm so excited to be ing to Penarth, said Ms Prichard.ldquoBefore March  it was truly one of the highlights of my month.ldquoThe last  months have been so hard on us all, and we all need a laugh more than ever."Giving it a new home of the Paget Rooms means bigger shows with even bigger comedians, and I really hope Penarth is going to support us so I can keep coming back!Howl Comedy Night will , at the new venue, from .pm on Saturday November .Guests can expect an evening of fun, drinks, and laughter, featuring:STUART GOLDSMITH " alt"Penarth Times: Stuart Goldsmith " class"editor-image"Stuart Goldsmith An internationally award-winning comedian, writer, podcaster, and host. As seen on CBSrsquos Late Night With Conan OrsquoBrien, Russell Howardrsquos Stand Up Centraland As Yet Untitled ..removeHe is also the host of hit comedy podcast, The Comedians Comedian. With a reputation for smart, accessible stand-up, Stuartrsquos enthusiasm and natural charm conceal a quick wit and fearlessness.DON BISWASDon BiswasDon Biswas is one of the gems of the circuit. A politically charged gag merchant who likes to cover a wide range of subjects including his Asian upbringing, his dyspraxia and conspiracy theories.SARAH BRIDGEMANSarah BridgemanFor the last decade Sarah Bridgeman has been a hit with audiences all over the UK with her warm and friendly style. She has been a weird news commentator for BBC Radio Wales, a finalist for the Welsh national comedy competition WUSA , and has written a play based on her experiences in comedy.LORNA PRICHARDLorna PrichardLorna Prichard is a comedian from North East Wales. She is also a trusted broadcaster, having appeared regularly on TV and radio for the last  years. She can frequently be heard on BBC Radio Wales following the success of her weekly show, lsquoSummer Saturdays with Lorna Prichardrsquo.Since then she has been presenting in studio on a regular basis with rugby legends Jonathan Edwards and Nigel Owens, and covering for other presenters like Kiri Pritchard-McLean.Her warm, natural manner and charm endear her to audiences of all ages. She is a gted improviser who can keep her cool no matter what.Following the debut of Howl at Paget Rooms it willfora Christmas show on Saturday, December , with the line-up to be announced soon.Tickets for upcoming shows are available at ticketsource howl article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentComments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. We hibernated until the time was right.ldquoWeve been in Safehouse studio, in Oxford, putting together our next two EPs. We believe the world is ready to believe in us. will be the first track featured on the bandrsquos Revamped EPset to release in .The single includes a YouTube video, directed by Matik, which includes lyrics to the track, and graphics by Lee Waters.You can check it out at www.youtu.be ZlKxbMydncThe rockers, who have both been playing their instruments for more than  years, love performing to crowds ndash something thatrsquos been limited over the past  months due to the Covid pandemic.Matik has described their shows as an ldquoexhilarating clash of pantomime and mosh-pit therapy and people can get their fix at Altered Mythsrsquo upcoming headline show.They will be at Vulcan Lounge, in Cardf, on November  with support band Mawpit. title: llantwit major waterspout weather gets spooky
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityJames Thomas, , an agent in the watersports industry, spotted the unusual phenomenon at Llantwit Major Beach in south Wales on Saturday morning.ldquoAs I stood there watching, I thought to myself, this is probably the best example of a waterspout that I will ever get to see in my letime, Mr Thomas told the PA news agency.ldquoOver the years I have seen quite a few of these over the Bristol Channel, but this was by far the biggest.Also known as funnel clouds or tuba, waterspouts form when a rotating column of wind draws in cloud droplets, according to the Met Office.Mr Thomas said he spied Saturdayrsquos weather spectacle while watching a surfing contest.ldquoIt started off fairly small, and quite high in the sky, and as we continued to watch, it appeared to get darker and began angling itself towards the surface of the sea, asit was coming towards us, he said.ldquoI quickly realised it was a waterspout when I could see the rotating spray on the waterrsquos surface, like a magnetic energy.ldquoI was shouting to all the competitors to look up and see this phenomenal natural occurrence.The sighting comes as the Met Office warned parts of the UK may have seen tornadoes on Sunday, as strong winds and rain batter the country.Gusts of over mph have been recorded and yellow warnings for wind and rain are in place over large parts of the west and where. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentComments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityJames Thomas, , an agent in the watersports industry, spotted the unusual phenomenon at Llantwit Major Beach in south Wales on Saturday morning.ldquoAs I stood there watching, I thought to myself, this is probably the best example of a waterspout that I will ever get to see in my letime, Mr Thomas told the PA news agency.ldquoOver the years I have seen quite a few of these over the Bristol Channel, but this was by far the biggest.Also known as funnel clouds or tuba, waterspouts form when a rotating column of wind draws in cloud droplets, according to the Met Office.Mr Thomas said he spied Saturdayrsquos weather spectacle while watching a surfing contest.ldquoIt started off fairly small, and quite high in the sky, and as we continued to watch, it appeared to get darker and began angling itself towards the surface of the sea, asit was coming towards us, he said.ldquoI quickly realised it was a waterspout when I could see the rotating spray on the waterrsquos surface, like a magnetic energy.ldquoI was shouting to all the competitors to look up and see this phenomenal natural occurrence.The sighting comes as the Met Office warned parts of the UK may have seen tornadoes on Sunday, as strong winds and rain batter the country.Gusts of over mph have been recorded and yellow warnings for wind and rain are in place over large parts of the west and where. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentComments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. title: help support bereavement
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityBrought to you byNEWSQUEST COMMERCIAL CONTENTSponsoredHelp and support through bereavementHere are of the best funeral directors that will offer just that and more.Green Willow FuneralsGreen Willows Funeral Home arealways at the heart of the community and the directors of Green Willow Funerals give their expertise, time and governance in a voluntary capacity. Their motivation is to ensure bereaved iniduals and families receive personal, respectful and affordable services and to ensure company profits are donated for charitable purposes.Furthermore, the directors set and promote an ethos and standards to which:The company and its staff will provide a transparent, compassionate service to its clients and the families that it serves.The approach to the client will be client-centred and, at all times, impartial professional advice will be provided, giving the client all options possible.We will enable and support the client and empower them to be the decision maker and, having provided the required information, ensure the client understands why they have made those decisions and that it remains appropriate to their needs.We will maintain professional fees that meet the needs of the company and its commitments and reflect the services provided however, these charges are not purely profit driven and are levied at a rate that provides a cost effective option to the clients and the communities that we serve when they are compared to the charges made by the companyrsquos competitors.All clients, regardless of gender, faith or belief are treated as equals. Green Willow Funerals is also an equal opportunity employer.As a company owned by a Christian and charitable body, the Cardf YMCATrust, the company and its staff aim to maintain and uphold in all matters Christian principles and teachings, althoughtheyare not required to be practising Christians.Phone: Newport |  Website:greenwillowfuneralsPark Funeral DirectorsWe continue to provide professional and respectful funeral services from our independent funeral homes situated in Barry, Vale of Glamorgan. Our establishment has been serving the local community for many years now. Park Funeral Directors are committed to ensuring your lost loved one receives the dignied and heartfelt send-off they deserve.Not to mention, your familyrsquos needs are our top priority, and we go above and beyond to ensure final wishes are met. As an independent, family-run funeral directors, we offer that extra personal touch to make sure the funeral service is as special as you envisage.We will bring your loved one into our care at either our Barry or Penarth site. Here, they will be treated with the utmost dignity and respect until the day of the funeral. Our facilities also offer tasteful and comfortable rest roomsin which you can spend time with the deceased in peace and solitude. Here, you will be able to share final moments of prayer or reflection with the deceased while in a safe and private setting. Our experienced staff will then guide you through the process of arranging the funeral, including sourcing memorials, flowers and stationery.We are committed to fulfilling the final requests of the deceased and their families. Therefore, you can rest assurethat any final requests will be followed to the letter wherever possible. If you have a funeral plan, your wishes will be carried out in accordance with your package.Alternatively, pre-determined requests of the deceased as well as those of the next of kin will be carried out. Our promise to you is that every funeral delivered by Park Funeral Directors will be conducted with the utmost in dignity and respect at all times.Phone:Barry |    Penarth |   Email:barry@parkfuneralsWebsite:parkfuneralsBrought to you byNEWSQUEST COMMERCIAL CONTENT s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"Comments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. title: st athan railway station considered
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityVale of Glamorgan Council has commissioned a consultancy firm to investigate the possibility of creating a railway station in St Athan.In the past there were two train stations based near the village Gileston and St Athan Road, but these are closed. A third railway station, named St Athan despite being three kilometres to the west of the village near Boverton also no longer operates.But with the Vale of Glamorgan Line reopening in  and new stations located at nearby Llantwit Major and Rhoose Cardf International Airport, the Council wants to explore whether there is an opportunity to re-establish a station near St Athan.Consultants Arcadis will look at an area around a section of the B, Barry to Llantwit Major Road, to determinea suitable site exists.They will consider many factors, including:Those relating to environmental featuresLand informationPlanning constraintsStation requirements, such as vehicle, pedestrian, and cycle accessCllr John Thomas, Vale of Glamorgan Council Ward Member for St Athan, said:ldquoIrsquom delighted that we are looking into the possibility of locating a railway station at St Athan."It has been a long time since one existed in the village and with the local population growing it is sensible that we look into expanding public transport services.Cllr Peter King, Vale of Glamorgan Council Cabinet Member for Neighbourhood services and Transport, added:ldquoI understand the appetite for a railway station in St Athan so we have commissioned consultants to determine whether such a move is feasible.ldquoIncreasing the use of public transport is in keeping with the Councilrsquos Project Zero initiative to reduce carbon emissions so this is something we are very interested in investigating.Once Arcadis have completed the study, their findings will be reported, and the Council will consider whether to take the matter forward. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey title: wales vs south africa autumn nations match   stream watch tv
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityThe hosts take on World Champions South Africa just seven days after their - defeat to New Zealand.However, unlike in that game, recent history favours Wales when it comes to South Africa.Wales have toppled the Springboks four times in a row at home, with South Africa last departing the Welsh capital victorious eight years ago.Credit: PAldquoWe are always trying to develop our game, said centre Davies, who took over captaincy duties when Alun Wyn Jones went off injured after just  minutes of the New Zealand encounter.ldquoThe one thing this team always shows is that the more time we spend together, the better we get.ldquoWe will dust ourselves off, come in on Monday and look to build and get a result next week at home.ldquoItrsquos the fine details ndash not moving forward on kicks, executing our exits correctly and not putting pressure on ourselves.Credit: PAldquoThe way South Africa play, they want to put pressure on you. For us, itrsquos making sure we build and play in the right areas of the field.ldquoLook, you work extremely hard to get a result, and when you donrsquot get it, it does hurt.ldquoThe beauty of it now is we have another opportunity next week to put the wrongs right. That is what this group will want to show next week.How to watch Wales vs South AfricaThe only way to watch Wales vs South Africa live this year is with Amazon Prime Video.The streaming service secured a new deal to exclusively broadcast Walesrsquo autumn games.All teams, except for Ireland who will be broadcast on Channel , will have their games shown behind the paywall.Amazon Prime costs pound. per month.Credit: PAUsually, Walesrsquo games would also be shown live on SC, however, with Amazon offering a Welsh language service, there will be no live coverage on the free-to-air channel..removeHighlights of all Wales matches will be shown on the evening of the test, with the South Africa highlights starting at .pm on Saturday.Walesrsquo Autumn Nations Series fixturesWales  -  New ZealandWales v South Africa, Principality Stadium, November , .pm kick off, Amazon Prime VideoWales v Fiji, Principality Stadium, November , .pm kick off, Amazon Prime VideoWales v Australia, Principality Stadium, November , .pm kick off, Amazon Prime Video article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentComments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. title: new building replace bowling pavilion belle vue park
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communitynew" New community building in Penarth park to get ‘hundreds of users a week’old" Skip to next photo Show caption  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl" href" my account emailthispage " s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentA NEW community building in a Penarth park is set to get hundreds of users a week, according to council bosses.The new building will replace the current bowling pavilion in Belle Vue Park, in Albert Crescent.Vale of Glamorgan councilrsquos planning committee approved permission for the replacement building last week.Councillor Kathryn McCaffer, cabinet member for leisure, arts and culture, said: ldquoThe new building will encourage a wide range of community groups to be able to use the space. Anyone who has attended a meeting or event in the current building can attest to how uninviting and inaccessible it is, and freezing cold.ldquoWhile itrsquos sad that the existing, dilapidated building needs to be demolished, it has had a long le which has mainly benefited the bowling club."I welcome the building of a new pavilion as a way to ensure the whole community is supported for future generations, so we can keep adding to the history of this location.David Knevett, operational manager for leisure and tourism, did not answer questions on the cost of the works, but expects hundreds of users each week.He said: ldquoThe new building is a considerable investment, and leisure services are keen that itrsquos used to its full potential. By combining community use, the use of the bowlers, and events, we are confident this can be achieved.ldquoWe feel the building provides a springboard for more community activity to take place in this area of Penarth. Wersquore really excited about this project and the opportunity this building will represent."A signicant amount of the cost is being funded through Section , and wersquove been fortunate enough to secure a grant from the lottery for this building.The new community building was welcomed by a local community group, Friends of Belle Vue, who took part in public consultations and fed into the final designs.The Friends Theo Hodgkinson said: ldquoWersquore really excited to see the positive impacts of having a purpose-built facility that is accessible to all age groups. Wersquore also excited about the energy-saving credentials of the building." article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentComments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. title: booster jab bookings extended month advance
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityThe NHS is changing the booking system to allow people in England to arrange an appointment a month in advance, as the health service aims to ramp up vaccination uptake ahead of a ldquochallenging winter.Currently, anyone eligible who had their second dose of a coronavirus vaccine six months ago can only book their top-up once those six months are up.The update means that people can pre-book an appointment after five months, allowing them to roll up their sleeve on the day they reach the six-month milestone.Health authorities hope this will speed up the booster rollout, strengthen the populationrsquos waning immunity to the virus and help reduce pressures on the NHS.Health Secretary Sajid Javid said: ldquoCovid- vaccines are the best way to protect yourself and your family ahead of a challenging winter and this change to the booking system will make it as easy as possible for people to book their booster jabs.ldquoThis will accelerate the booster programme, ensure the NHS is able to vaccinate people as quickly as possible, and importantly help more people maintain protection against Covid- as we know immunity will dip over time.This autumn winter itrsquos essential you protect yourself and others against both flu and COVID-.If youre eligible, book your flu and COVID- booster vaccines now. https:t.co xspJfkIQDj pic pMjBVWHcEmdash NHS England and NHS ImprovementNovember , People can also book by calling  or turn up without an appointment at hundreds of walk-in vaccination sites across England six months after their second dose to get their top-up.NHS England said more than nine million people have already had a top-up vaccine, and it wants to see those numbers bolstered ahead of colder winter weather which typically leads to increased virus transmission..removeNHS national medical director Stephen Powis said: ldquoWhile this winter is undoubtedly going to be dferent, the most important thing you can do is come forward for both your Covid booster and flu jab as soon as possible ndash now with the added convenience of booking in advance ndash making it even easier to protect yourself and loves ones. vw,vw,px, px"London Mayor Sadiq Khan receives his flu and Covid- booster jab People entitled to a booster jab are those aged  and over, people who live and work in care homes, frontline health and social care workers, people aged  and over with a health condition that puts them at high risk of getting seriously ill from Covid-, those aged  and over who are a main carer for someone at high risk from the virus, and people aged  and over who live with someone who is more likely to get infections.The NHS is also urging those eligible for a free flu vaccination to take up the offer..push,i[r].l*new Dateas,ms[]a.asynca.srcgmgagagagagagagagagagaga, title: Booster jab bookings extended to a month in advance article_url title: aldi donating food charities christmas   get involved
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityFood that does not sell in stores will be donated to local charities rather than go to waste.As part of Aldirsquos pledge to donate  million meals this year to families across the UK facing hunger, the supermarket has committed to donate more meals over the festive period.Christmas is a great time for organisations to benefit from Aldirsquos partnership with Neighbourly, a community engagement  that links businesses to food banks and charities.This enables Aldirsquos UK stores to donate surplus food seven days a week, all year round.Aldi stores will be closed on Christmas Day, Boxing Day and New Years DayWith all Aldi stores set to close on Christmas Day, Boxing Day and NewYearrsquos Day, the retailer wants to ensure that any products approaching the end of their shelf-le reach wont be wasted and can be given to families who might otherwise miss out this Christmas.Charities, food banks and community groups who could benefit from the scheme are encouraged to get in touch and register now for a festive food donation from the supermarket.Existing charity partnerships will be prioritised for these festive collections, but where therersquos availability, additional organisations are being invited to apply to be paired with a local Aldi store to collect fresh and chilled food products ndash including fruit, vegetables, fresh meat, fish and bread ndash ahead of stores closing on both Christmas Eve and New Yearrsquos Eve.Did you know you can get your remembrance poppy in your local Aldi Heres a few of the things were doing to remember our fallen heroes.## #ArmisticeDay #RemembranceSunday pic wsbUgZsKHmdash Aldi Stores UKNovember , Mary Dunn, Managing Director of Corporate Responsibility at Aldi UK, said: ldquoOur food donations scheme operates year-round, but we know that Christmas can be a particularly dficult time for the families and communities we support..removeldquoThatrsquos why we are so committed to increasing the number of meals we donate over the festive season, and we look forward to working with local charities this Christmas to help us meet our  million meals target for the year.Steve Butterworth, from Neighbourly, added: ldquoWith the impact of the pandemic still being felt by communities up and down the country, charities and local causes are eaxpecting record demand for their services this Christmas.ldquoWersquore sure there are lots more groups out there that could put this food to good use, so wersquod encourage them to get in touch.Organisations do not need to be a registered charity to apply but must:Have a level two hygiene certicate gained in the last two yearsBe able to transport and store chilled food products after collecting them on Christmas Eve and New Yearrsquos Eve at pmThose interested in working with Aldi this Christmas should contact Neighbourly at aldichristmas@neighbourly before th December .Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: aldi offering courses help babies sleep
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityAldirsquos baby and toddler brand, Mamia, will start making infant sleeping courses affordable for all UK families.Part of its Specialbuy range, in partnership with Just Chill Baby Sleep, Aldi will help to establish healthy sleep routines for parents and their children.Online courses will start from as little as pound. This is a % discount on standard rates across all sleep courses.Parents can choose from four informative courses that cater for new-borns to four-year-olds:Foundations of Sleep: - months.Practical advice on how to navigate the first few months with a new baby, helping to lay solid sleep foundations and understand their sleep habits: pound. .Sleep Success: - months.Help with nap and bedtime challenge and understanding your babyrsquos sleep needs to help them sleep peacefully and achieve a better sleep quality: pound .Sleep Success: - months.Advice on how to successfully navigate nap times, bedtime and approach nighttime wakingrsquos for a better quality sleep: pound .Sleep Success:  months to  years.Understand a childrsquos sleep needs, including when and how to successfully transition them from a cot to a bed, allowing them to sleep happily in their own space: pound .Rosey Davidson, Infant Sleep Consultant and Founder of Just Chill Baby Sleep, says: ldquoIrsquom so excited that Just Chill Baby Sleep is partnering with Aldirsquos baby and toddler brand, Mamia."For so many parents the cost of in-person sleep support is out of reach, which is why we created our online courses and why this partnership means so much."To be able to offer our courses at a massive % discount and reach even more parents in need is fantastic, and wersquore looking forward to helping new parents and their little ones get the best night sleep possible..remove" alt"Penarth Times: Aldi is offering courses on how to get your baby to sleep for under pound " class"editor-image"Aldi is offering courses on how to get your baby to sleep for under pound Here to offer some advice, Rosey has put together a parental checklist for bedtime which she has shared exclusively with Mamia, to give parents a helping hand at what can be the most dficult time of the day:Have a regular, predictable routineHaving a good balance of sleep in the day can really help your baby to sleep well at night. While all babies are dferent, it can be helpful to think about working towards a routine by doing the same things in the same order each night so that baby learns what is coming next.Think about your little onersquos sleep environmentIt can be helpful to black out bedrooms, something that can be especially important in the summer months. Temperature is also important the Lullaby Trust, the baby sleep charity, say that the safest temperature for our little ones is - degrees celsius.Looking at how your little one falls asleep can help them get a more settled nightIt is very normal for your little one to be fed, rocked or cuddled to sleep, however this can be dficult to maintain. Practice other ways of getting your baby to sleep in their own sleep space to help find a method that suits you, your baby and your parenting style.Watch out for signs of tirednessWhile there are typical s of time that babies will happily stay awake for, the most important thing is getting to know your baby. By observing your baby, you can try to get them down for naps during the day before they get overtired. It is also important not to try to force naps when they are under tired.Fresh air and exerciseGetting out of the house for a bit will blow the cobwebs away and help your little one to burn off some energy. Inside the home your little one will also benefit from lots of time on the floor to keep them moving, while for small babies practising a bit of tummy time can be really helpful.Donrsquot always rush inhellipSometimes your little one will babble or make noise while they are asleep, and by going in too quickly we can disturb them. Equally they can sometimes wake and be happy in their sleep space. If your little one doesnrsquot need your assistance it is important to give them the space to get themselves back to sleep independently.Take care of yourself and donrsquot be afraid to ask for helpTherersquos no shame in not being able to do it all, all of the time. Being sleep deprived can be incredibly challenging and feel very lonely. Please know that is very normal for sleep to be dficult, especially in those early days. Please remember being a parent doesnrsquot always feel easy, because itrsquos not! You are doing a great job.To book a course or find out more, visit the Aldi website.Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: celebrity  previous winners itv show now
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityITV has announced the new serieshosted by Ant and Dec willon Sunday, November .Confirmed: Im A Celebrity...Get Me Out Of Here! starts Sunday  November at pm on ITV.@itv @antanddec @imacelebrity #ImACeleb pic zpleOJBBHRmdash ITV Press CentreNovember , This yearrsquos show will once again be filmed from the historic Gwrych Castle, Abergele in North Wales.Winning the show can often lead to greater fame with lucrative deals and business deals up for grabs for the lucky winner making every dreaded Bushtucker Trial worth it.However, le is not always plain sailing for Jungle castle royalty after ing to normality.Here we take a look at every previous winner of the hit ITV show and find out what theyrsquore up to now.Tony Blackburn -" alt"Penarth Times: Tony Blackburn was the first Im A Celebrity winner. " class"editor-image"Tony Blackburn was the first Im A Celebrity winner. The show made its debut in  with a host of famous celebs including Tara Palmer-Tomkinson, Uri Geller and Christine Hamilton.It was -year-old radio DJ Tony Blackburn who captured the hearts of the nation and was crowned King of the jungle.After leaving the show he continued to have an impressive broadcasting career with the BBC until a brief hiatus in  before ing to be a regular on BBC Radio Two.He is now retired at the age of .Phil Tufnell - " alt"Penarth Times: Former England cricketer Phil Tufnell won the show in . " class"editor-image"Former England cricketer Phil Tufnell won the show in . Former England cricketer Phil Tufnell announced his retirement from the sport shortly before being named as a contestant on the second series of Irsquom A Celeb.His quick wit made him a hit with viewers and the second winner on the show has gone on to become a TV regular.He became a team captain on They Think Itrsquos all over in  before landing his most popular role as team captain on BBCrsquos A Question Of Sport.Phil made it to week nine on the  series of Strictly Come Dancing and appeared on Channel s The Jump..removeHe can still be seen in the small screen today, most recently his golf Netflix show, This Could Go Anywhere.Kerry Katona - " alt"Penarth Times: Kerry Katona became the first Queen of the jungle in . " class"editor-image"Kerry Katona became the first Queen of the jungle in . Kerry Katona became the first Queen of the jungle in  after winning the first of two series that year.Since leaving the jungle Kerry has been in the headlines for a number of reason. She has had a string of relationships in the public eye, including the public break up former husband Brian McFadden.She was inundated with TV offers as she became the face of Iceland and starred in her own reality TV show. She has also appeared on Celebrity Big Brother and Dancing on Ice.Away from our screens the former Atomic Kitten star has recovered from bankruptcy twice, battled drug and alcohol problems and been diagnosed with bipolar disorder.She now creates content for online  OnlyFans among other things.Joe Pasquale - Irsquom A Celeb ed for a second series in .Comedian Joe Pasquale beat off fierce competition from a host of famous faces including former royal butler Paul Burrell, Janet Street Porter and Vic Reeves.After leaving he continued a string of comedy tours and appeared on the  season of Dancing in Ice ing a year later for the showrsquos all-stars season.He still makes the occasional TV appearance, most recently The Nightly Show in .Carol Thatcher - The daughter of former Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher, Carol was a journalist and author before heading to the jungle.She won over viewers with her no-nonsense approach to Bushtucker Trialrsquos.She went on to become a regular on The One Show before being dropped by the BBC after referring to a Tennis player as a ldquogolliwog in an off-camera discussion with Adrian Chiles and Jo Brand.She wrote a book about growing up as the PMrsquos daughter and her motherrsquos battle with dementia.Matt Willis - " alt"Penarth Times: Matt Willis and his we, tv presenter Emma Willis. " class"editor-image"Matt Willis and his we, tv presenter Emma Willis. Busted musician Matt Willis appeared in the  intsalment of the show alongside famous faces including Myleene Klass, Jason Donovan and Dean Gaffney.Hehad already found solo success after leaving Busted before joining the show but turned his attention to TV after winning the crown.Matt hosted the Irsquom A Celeb spin-off show Irsquom A Celebrity: Extra Camp alongside then girlfriend Emma Grfiths for the  series.He has enjoyed a number of acting roles including in the revival of Birds of a Feather and a brief spell on Eastenders, playing the role of Luke Riley.He has since appeared on stage, including roles in Wicked and Footloose.He now has three children with girlfriend Emma, Isabelle, , Ace, eight, and Trixie, four.Christopher Biggins - " alt"Penarth Times: Christopher Biggins beat off competition from Gemma Atkinson and Janice Dickinson. " class"editor-image"Christopher Biggins beat off competition from Gemma Atkinson and Janice Dickinson. The veteran actor was already a household name famous for roles in shows such as Upstairs, Downstairs and Porridge.He beat off competition from Gemma Atkinson and Janice Dickinson to claim the title of King of the jungle.He went on to appear in a number of celebrity shows including Come Dine With Me and Masterchef.In  he was booted off Celebrity Big Brother after a number of ldquooffensive outbursts that werenrsquot shown on TV.Joe Swash - " alt"Penarth Times: Joe Swash made it to the final of this yearrsquos Celebrity MasterChef. " class"editor-image"Joe Swash made it to the final of this yearrsquos Celebrity MasterChef. The former Eastenders star won the eighthseries of the show in .Since leaving the show Swash hosted Extra Camp for nearly a decade alongside stars such as Caroline Flack and his now fiance Stacey Solomon.More recently he has appeared on Celebrity Gogglebox and won Dancing on Ice at the start of , before making it to the final of this yearrsquos Celebrity MasterChef.He welcomed his second child, Rose Opal Esme Solomon-Swash, with Stacey Solomon after welcoming their son, Rex, in .The pair got engaged last Christmas but delayed their wedding after she announced her pregnancy in June.Gino DrsquoAcampo - " alt"Penarth Times: Gino is now regular on This Morning and Celebrity Juice. " class"editor-image"Gino is now regular on This Morning and Celebrity Juice. Celebrity chef Gino won the  series despite controversy.After leaving the jungle both he and co-star Stuart Manning faced animal cruelty charges for killing and cooking a rat during the show.The charges were later dropped when ITV took responsibility and paid a pound, fine.Gino is now regular on This Morning and Celebrity Juice. He also presents ITVs Family Fortunes.He can also be seen travelling the world with fellow chef Gordon Ramsay and First dates restaurant manager Fred Serieix in Gordon, Gino and Fred.Stacey Solomon - " alt"Penarth Times: Stacey Solomon is a regular on ITVs Loose Women. " class"editor-image"Stacey Solomon is a regular on ITVs Loose Women. Stacey Solomon rose to fame after finishing runner-up to Joe McElderry and Olly Murs on The X Factor.She released her debut album, Shy, in  and has been a regular list on Loose Women since .She took over from Laura Whitmore as presenter of Irsquom A Celeb Extra Camp before being dropped in .It was here her romance with no fianceacute and fellow Irsquom A Celeb winner Joe Swash begun.They are now engaged to be married and welcomed their second child earlier this year.Dougie Poynter ndash " alt"Penarth Times: McFlys Dougie Pointer won the show in . " class"editor-image"McFlys Dougie Pointer won the show in . McFlyrsquos Dougie Poynter won the show while taking a break from the band in .McFly have recently released new music and took part in numerous tours around the UK ndash they also teamed up with Busted to create the supergroup McBusted.He has also seen success as a model for brands including Dolce  Gabbana.Charlie Brooks ndash " alt"Penarth Times: Charlie Brooks has recently ed to Eastenders. " class"editor-image"Charlie Brooks has recently ed to Eastenders. The  winner is best known for her role as Janine Butcher in BBC soap Eastenders.Following her win, she continued with her role until .Since then, she has appeared in a number of TV shows and has seen success with fitness DVDs following her own weight loss.Charlie has recently ed to Albert Square to reprise her role as Janine Butcher in Eastenders.Kian Egan ndash Westle star Kian joined the show after his band split and the girlband he managed, Wonderland, failed.He released his debut solo album after winning the show and reached number  in the UK charts.Since then he has gone on to be a coach on The Voice of Ireland.Im A Celebrity...Get Me Out Of Here! quiz Test your knowldge here:Carl Fogarty ndash Carl ldquoFoggy Fogarty was a superbike champion before winning the th series after forming a hilarious friendship with former Premier League footballer Jimmy Bullard.He won the show after eating bull penis and ostrich anus during the live final.Following the show he set up fellow contestant Jake Quickenden with his own daughter, Danielle.The couple are no longer together.Vicky Pattison" alt"Penarth Times: Vicky Pattison joined the show after quitting MTV hit Geordie Shore.. " class"editor-image"Vicky Pattison joined the show after quitting MTV hit Geordie Shore.. Vicky Pattison joined the show after quitting MTV hit Geordie Shore.Since leaving as queen of the jungle she became a celebrity fitness influencer and presented Extra Camp for one year after being crowned winner.She also appeared in the Australian version of the show.She regularly updates fans on Instagram and can be seen on TV shows, most recently Celebrity SAS: Who Dares Wins.Scarlett Moffatt ndash " alt"Penarth Times: Scarlett rose to fame after appearing with her family on Channel rsquos hit show Gogglebox. " class"editor-image"Scarlett rose to fame after appearing with her family on Channel rsquos hit show Gogglebox. Scarlett rose to fame after appearing with her family on Channel rsquos hit show Gogglebox and proved a hit with ITV viewers after being crowned queen of the jungle.He appearance on the show impressed host Ant and Dec s much that she was invited to co-host Ant  Decrsquos Saturday Night Takeaway. She also co hosted spin-off show Extra Camp during the following season.Georgia lsquoToffrsquo Toffolo ndash " alt"Penarth Times: lsquoToffrsquo rose to fame after appearing in Ersquos reality series Made in Cha. " class"editor-image"lsquoToffrsquo rose to fame after appearing in Ersquos reality series Made in Cha. lsquoToffrsquo rose to fame after appearing in Ersquos reality series Made in Cha.Despite her posh background her friendship with Stanley Johnson and her down to earth personality won the hearts of ITV viewers.Since leaving the jungle she can regularly be seen presenting on ITVrsquos This Morning and has popped up in Celebrity Gogglebox alongside her friend Stan, who just happens to be the Prime Ministerrsquos dad.Harry Redknapp ndash " alt"Penarth Times: Harry Redknapp had ITV viewers in stitches on Im A Celeb. " class"editor-image"Harry Redknapp had ITV viewers in stitches on Im A Celeb. Harry Redknapp already had a strong following from his football career, particularly as a manager but gained a whole new following after winning the show in .Having never watched the show, Harry had viewers in stitches and his undying love for his we, Sandra, made him a hit with viewers.He has since gone on to star in numerous TV shows and recently sold his Sandbanks home to build his wersquos dream home nearby.Jacqueline Jossa ndash " alt"Penarth Times: Jacqueline Jossa. " class"editor-image"Jacqueline Jossa. Jacqueline rose to fame portraying Lauren Branning in BBC soap Eastenders.She received backing from viewers after campmate Myles Stephenson apparently told the actress her husband Dan Osbourne had romantic fling with his ex, Gabby Allen.She became the first winner to cancel all interviews when the show came to an end and enjoyed time with her family.She has since built a huge following on social media and has launched a range of clothing lines.Giovanna Fletcher ndash " alt"Penarth Times: Giovanna Fletcher won over her fellow campmates and the public. " class"editor-image"Giovanna Fletcher won over her fellow campmates and the public. Giovanna Fletcher won over her fellow campmates and the public after showing her caring side during Irsquom A Celebrityhellip Get Me Out Of Here!Radio DJ Jordan North, who came in second place, labelled her the ldquokindest person I have ever met after she was revealed as the victor.Giovanna has continued her work as a podcaster and writer and is currently supporting her husband Tom Fletcher on this article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"Comments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. title: road repairs branded diabolical
story: Nigel Dawson appointed District Master of Portadown LOL No   Upper Bann is in ‘housing crisis’ with current rate of build ‘woefully inadequate’NewsTraffic and TravelCrimeWeatherPoliticsBusinessEducationHealthPeopleRead ThisCoronavirusSportFootballOther SportWhats OnArts and EntertainmentThings To DoHomes and GardensLestyleCarsHomes and GardensPublic NoticesAdvertise My BusinessFree Happy AdsNewsPoliticsRoad repairs branded ‘diabolical’A Portadown councillor has hit out at the condition in which a road was left following recent utility work in the area.By The NewsroomThursday, th November , : am  "       "  The work in question involved the laying of pipes for Firmus Energy on the Armagh Road, Portadown. While acknowledging the work led to delays for motorists, Councillor Lavelle McIlwrath said they were viewed as a necessaryevil in order to deliver services to the area.However, he criticisedthe condition of the repair work between the traffic lights at Mahon junction an Ridgeway Park, describing it as “diabolical”.“I have had numerous complaints from motorists about the way the Armagh Road has been left.“The section of roadway that was dug up cannot now be avoided as you drive towards town and the uneven way the repaired carriageway has been left is shocking.“The irony is that this stretch of roadway was one of the better ones in the area prior to the roadworks and is now one of the worst.”Cllr McIlwrath confirmed he had raisedthe matter with both Firmus Energy and the Department for Infrastructure and said they energy firm has agreed tothe road to its original standard.“I raisedthe matter directly with Firmus Energy as well as the Department for Infrastructure,” he said.“I am pleased to confirm that Firmus Energy has agreed to revisittheir repairs at the Armagh Road and ensure that this stretch of carriageway is ed to its original standard.“The work will take several weeks to plan and coordinate.”Speaking to the Local Democracy Reporting Service, a spokesperson for Firmus Energy confirmed the road surface will be repaired.“We have been liaising with Councillor McIlwrath, the Department for Infrastructure and our contractors to agree a plan to repair the road surface and hope to have that work completed as soon as possible.”Editor’s message:Thank you for reading this article. We’re more reliant on your support than ever as the sht in consumer habits brought about by Coronavirus impacts our advertisers.Please consider purchasing a copy of the paper. title: mike nesbitt joins calls for apology over mlas sectarian ruc comments
story: Halloween hooligans’ rampage in Lurgan ‘terried’ residents   Road repairs branded ‘diabolical’NewsTraffic and TravelCrimeWeatherPoliticsBusinessEducationHealthPeopleRead ThisCoronavirusSportFootballOther SportWhats OnArts and EntertainmentThings To DoHomes and GardensLestyleCarsHomes and GardensPublic NoticesAdvertise My BusinessFree Happy AdsNewsPoliticsMike Nesbitt joins calls for apology over MLA’s ‘sectarian’ RUC commentsA row over an MLA’s claim the RUC represented “institutionalised sectarianism” has escalated with Mike Nesbitt joining calls for Dolores Kelly to apologise.By Mark RaineyFriday, th November , : pm  "       "  RUC officer at the scene of a terrorist atrocity in Belfast city centre in . Photo: PacemakerUpper Bann MLA Mrs Kelly was quoted in a newspaper article as saying this week’s PSNI th anniversary was the perfect opportunity to recommit to the principle of a shared police force. The SDLP policing board member also said the creation of the PSNI was a “signicant departure from the institutionalised sectarianism represented by the RUC”.Those comments led to the NI Retired Police Officers’ Association penning an open letter to Mrs Kelly, in which the NIRPOA chairman called on the MLA to withdraw her remarks, and to apologise for the “gross offence” caused.The letter states: “I am writing to seek your immediate withdrawal of that remark, and an apology for the gross offence you have caused to the thousands of members of the Royal Ulster Constabulary GC who served this community in the most challenging of times.”Mrs Kelly responded, saying: “The SDLP has previously paid tribute to the sacrices made by many RUC officers and their families.“The fact remains that there were severe institutional problems within the RUC and this is a matter of public record. That many retired police officers continue to refuse to cooperate with legacy investigations to this day speaks for itself.”Mrs Kelly added: “The transformation of the RUC to the PSNI has been an outstanding success and whilst policing continues to be challenging I think the hard work and efforts of the those involved in implementing Patten’s recommendations deserve credit.”Ulster Unionist policing board member Mr Nesbitt said he believes his SDLP counterpart should “reflect on her comments and the hurt they have caused and apologise”.He said: “The RUC were the barrier between Northern Ireland and complete anarchy. They bravely held the line throughout the Troubles.“Dolores Kelly’s comments have caused great hurt to former officers, their families and friends. Police officers didn’t wake up hoping to hurt someone, but every terrorist did, and it was police officers who were targeted simply because they were trying to protect society and save lives”.Mr Nesbitt added: “Nobody disputes that the RUC could have done with more Catholic officers within its ranks.“I have no doubt that many more would have come forward had it not been for the fact that the IRA made a special effort to target those Catholics who did join the RUC”.Mike NesbittPSNI  "       "  Most PopularRoad repairs branded ‘diabolical’Mike Nesbitt joins calls for apology over MLA’s ‘sectarian’ RUC commentsPSNI spend  minutes ‘holding’ person sitting on Bann River Bridge in PortadownNigel Dawson appointed District Master of Portadown LOL No‘Viable device’ found by bomb experts during Craigavon security alertMost PopularUpper Bann is in ‘housing crisis’ with current rate of build ‘woefully inadequate’Portadown church hosts charity quiz in aid of TearfundArtists, young and older, exhibiting at Portadown’s Millennium CourtPortadown murder: Shock in rural community after man arrested on suspicion of murderStephen Barriskill killing: PSNI charge -year-old man with murder                       This website and its associated newspaper are members of Independent Press Standards Organisation Follow us on    ExploreNewsSportWhats OnLestyleMore from Portadown TimesAnnouncementsJobsPublic NoticesMust ReadBuy a PhotoDirectoryUseful LinksContact UsAdvertise My BusinessAdvertise a JobPlace your AdSubscribeEventsArchiveReaders Charter " fill"#ea"  ©JPIMedia Publishing Ltd. ." target"_self" href"#" id"cookieSettings" class"sc-dqBHgY sc-gxMtzJ bAegnq"Cookie SettingsTerms and ConditionsPrivacy policyModern Slavery Statement  News you can trust since News" class"expand" role"button" tabindex""  " "  "  scale translate " points"  .  . title: top tips for safe student accommodation
story: With freshers week around the corner and thousands of young people in Northern Ireland set to start University or new career paths, many will be on the hunt for rented accommodation. Northern Ireland has experienced a .% increase in average rental values this year[]. With the price increase, OFTEC, representing the liquid fuel industry in Ireland, is concerned that students may take cheaper accommodation options without properly inspecting the property. With this in mind, OFTEC has issued advise to help students ensure their accommodation is safe before they sign the dotted line. Raise the alarm – Currently, it is not a mandatory requirement for private landlords to provide smoke and carbon monoxide detectors, but the HSENI recommend that they do. It is a legal requirement to fit a carbon monoxide detector when a fossil fuel appliance has been replaced. Carbon monoxide is potentially lethal as it has no smell, taste or colour. Without a working alarm, it is impossible to identy carbon monoxide leaks. OFTEC’s advise is to ensure that there are working fire and CO alarms in the property, and that they are tested on a regular basis.Heating requirements - The Health  Safety Executive recommend that all boilers should be serviced annually and tenants should ask for evidence of recent servicing. If you have concerns, ask for a CD  Landlord Oil Installation Check which is carried out by an OFTEC registered technician and will give you peace of mind. For a gas heated property, ask for a copy of the annual gas safety check.Look for damp – It is easy to hide damp patches with a coat of paint, soyour house smells musty or you see evidence of mould, find out how the landlord is planning to fix the problem. Mould has no place in the home as it can cause respiratory problems and headaches.Furniture and fittings – Ask the landlord for a list of everything that is included and make note of any damage that is there before you move it. Check any beds, sofas and chairs are in good condition.Secure your home – burglars may target student areas because of lax security. Ask your landlord to fit key operating locks on the windows and lever deadlocks on external doors.  OFTEC Ireland Manager, David Blevings, said: “Quite often the excitement of moving in with friends can overshadow the concerns about the accommodation itself. We are urging students to play it safe this year and carry out these essential checks before signing a lease and moving in. “Asking a landlord about safety may seem awkward, but it could prevent you from living in a potentially dangerous property for the next  months. It’s vital that your new home is not a burden as you start your time at university.
